text: The 2000-01 Brown Bears women's ice hockey team represented Brown University. ==Regular season== *Freshman Kim Fleet only appeared in 13 games. *Courtney Johnson appeared in 29 games and registered three game-winning goals. All 11 of her goals came in ECAC games. Johnson would rank third on the Bears in points accumulated in ECAC contests. *Kristy Zamora was the top returning goal scorer for the Bears from the previous campaign. Zamora appeared in all 29 games for the team. ==Player stats== ===Skaters=== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style=" background:#321414;color:#FFFFFF;" | Player || Games Played || Goals || Assists|| Points|| Game Winning Goals |- align="center" bgcolor="" |Kathleen Kauth ||29 ||16 ||23 ||39 ||4 |- align="center" bgcolor="" |} ===Goaltenders=== {|class="wikitable" width="80%" |- align="center" style=" background:#321414;color:#FFFFFF;" | Player || Games Played || Wins || Losses|| Ties|| Goals Against|| Minutes|| Goals Against Average|| Shutouts|| Saves|| Save Percentage |- align="center" bgcolor="" |} ==Awards and honors== * Courtney Johnson, Sakuma Award winner * Christina Sorbara, 2001 Sarah Devens Award ==References== ==External links== *Official site Category:Brown Bears women's ice hockey seasons Brown Brown Brown
